meanings.definition: An amount of something that is more than necessary, permitted, or desirable.
meanings.sent1: She had an excess of candy after Halloween.
meanings.sent2: The excess of luggage made it difficult to close the suitcase.
meanings.sent3: His excess of jokes always lightens the mood.
meanings.sent4: The excess of rain flooded the streets.
meanings.sent5: The excess of homework overwhelmed the students.

meanings.definition: The state of surpassing or going beyond a certain limit or norm.
meanings.sent1: The excess of speed led to a ticket.
meanings.sent2: The excess of noise disrupted the meeting.
meanings.sent3: Her excess of energy is contagious.
meanings.sent4: The excess of stars in the sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The excess of colors in the painting was mesmerizing.
